div.head: CHAP. VI.
1 Dauids complaint in his sicknesse. 8 By faith he triumpheth ouer his enemies.
div.ab: [To the chiefe musician on Neginoth vpon Sheminith, A Psalme of Dauid.] O Lord, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure. Psa.26.1.
Haue mercy vpon me, O Lord, for I am weake: O Lord heale mee, for my bones are vexed.
My soule is also sore vexed: but thou, O Lord, how long?
Returne, O Lord, deliuer my soule: oh saue mee, for thy mercies sake.
For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the graue who shall giue thee thankes? Psal.30. 12 & 88.11 &115.17. & 118.17. Esay.38. 18.
I am weary with my groning, all the night make I my bed to swim: I water my couch with my teares. Or, euery night.
Mine eie is consumed because of griefe; it waxeth olde because of all mine enemies.
Depart from me, all yee workers of iniquitie: for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping. Mat.7.23. & 25.41. Luc.13.27.
The Lord hath heard my supplication; the Lord will receiue my prayer.
Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them returne and be ashamed suddainly.
